Class Model

  • java.lang.Object
    • Model

  • public class Model
extends java.lang.Object
    Model class that converts a directed graph representing a precedence constrained knapsack problem into a mathematical programming model managed by CPLEX.
    Author:
    Paul Bouman

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Model(DirectedGraph<Item,java.lang.String> instance, int capacity)
      Constructor that takes a directed graph with the items and precedence constraints

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void cleanup()
      Cleans up the CPLEX model in order to free up some memory.
      java.util.List<Item> getSolution()
      Create a list of the items for which the decision variables are one in the current solution of the mathematical program.
      boolean isFeasible()
      Checks whether the current solution to the model is feasible
      void setItem(Item i, boolean enabled)
      Disable an item in the model (fix it to 0) or enable it (either 0 or 1)
      void solve()
      Solve the Mathematical Programming Model

    • Constructor Detail

      • Model

        public Model(DirectedGraph<Item,java.lang.String> instance,
             int capacity)
      throws ilog.concert.IloException
        Constructor that takes a directed graph with the items and precedence constraints
        Parameters:
        instance - a directed graph with items
        capacity - the capacity of the knapsack
        Throws:
        ilog.concert.IloException - if something goes wrong with CPLEX

    • Method Detail

      • setItem

        public void setItem(Item i,
                    boolean enabled)
             throws ilog.concert.IloException
        Disable an item in the model (fix it to 0) or enable it (either 0 or 1)
        Parameters:
        i - the item to manipulate
        enabled - whether to enable it (0 or 1) or disable it (always 0)
        Throws:
        ilog.concert.IloException - if something is wrong with CPLEX

      • solve

        public void solve()
           throws ilog.concert.IloException
        Solve the Mathematical Programming Model
        Throws:
        ilog.concert.IloException - if something is wrong with CPLEX

      • isFeasible

        public boolean isFeasible()
                   throws ilog.concert.IloException
        Checks whether the current solution to the model is feasible
        Returns:
        the feasibility of the model
        Throws:
        ilog.concert.IloException - if something is wrong with CPLEX

      • getSolution

        public java.util.List<Item> getSolution()
                                 throws ilog.concert.IloException
        Create a list of the items for which the decision variables are one in the current solution of the mathematical program.
        Returns:
        a list of selected items
        Throws:
        ilog.concert.IloException - if something is wrong with CPLEX

      • cleanup

        public void cleanup()
             throws ilog.concert.IloException
        Cleans up the CPLEX model in order to free up some memory. This is important if you create many models, as memory used by CPLEX is not freed up automatically by the JVM.
        Throws:
        ilog.concert.IloException - if something goes wrong with CPLEX
